result.execSummary:
On one or more other charges, Roosevelt Nmi Allen Jr. was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Roosevelt Nmi Allen Jr. is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Alexis S. Mckinley, DF ATTY: John A Kucinski, DF: Roosevelt Nmi Allen appeared.  Court called.  Set for court trial.  Court reviews the DE's rights to have a jury trial.  Court finds the DE  freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives his right to a jury trial.  Motion to sequestor is granted.  Court proceeds with the Court Trial.  S/T of J.S.  Direct by ADA Mckinley.  DE is identified by J.S.   State's Ex. 2 O/Attorney Kucinski objects subject to cross.  Court reserves.  Cross by Attorney Kucinski.  DE - Ex. A. O/R.  DE - Ex. B. O/R. Witness excused.  S/T of Officer Adam Ballow of the New Richmond Police Department. Direct by ADA Mckinley.  Cross by Attorney Kucinski.  DE - Ex. C.  O/R.  Re-direct by ADA Mckinley.  Re-cross by Attorney Kucinski.  DE - Ex. D O/R.  Attorneys continue questioning.  Witness excused.  State rests.  Attorney Kucinski takes short recess out of the courtroom to discuss with his client testifying.  Attorney Kucinski advises the defense rests.  Attorneys make argument.  Court finds the DE Not Guilty of Ct.1.  Court finds the DE adjudicated guilty of Ct. 2 and stays the adjudication of guilt from 1 year from todays hearing.  Court will dismiss Ct. 2 if the DE remains incident free for 1 year.   Court adjourned.  lw

DE appeared at counter stating his name was not on the board for his court trial.  DE was advised that he has court on 6-26-17 @ 10:45 am in courtroom 3 & a notice of hearing was mailed to him on 4-27-17 but his mail was ret'd as his apt # was incorrect.  jaf

Atty. J. Kucinski. gme
Pre-trial conference at 01-04-2016 03:45 pm

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Julie S.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Defendant not allowed at the residence.

Further, it is ordered that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis Stats.

Defendant to get his belongings with a Uniformed Officer.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: Steve Dunalp for EJL, RPR: Val Deiss, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA: Alexis S. Mckinley,  DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski,  DF:  Roosevelt Nmi Allen appeared from jail. Court confirms address. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Waives speedy trial. ADA McKinley requests $250.00 CB, Atty Kucinski argues.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 4, 2016 at 03:45 pm.
